message_1:
What is the seasonal pattern of monthly average temperatures in a certain city over a period of 5 years? Use time series analysis to identify if there is any significant trend or seasonality in the data. The data is as follows:

Year 1: Jan=10°C, Feb=11°C, Mar=13°C, Apr=18°C, May=22°C, Jun=25°C, Jul=28°C, Aug=27°C, Sep=24°C, Oct=20°C, Nov=15°C, Dec=12°C

Year 2: Jan=11°C, Feb=12°C, Mar=14°C, Apr=19°C, May=23°C, Jun=26°C, Jul=29°C, Aug=28°C, Sep=25°C, Oct=21°C, Nov=16°C, Dec=13°C

Year 3: Jan=12°C, Feb=13°C, Mar=15°C, Apr=20°C, May=24°C, Jun=27°C, Jul=30°C, Aug=29°C, Sep=26°C, Oct=22°C, Nov=17°C, Dec=14°C

Year 4: Jan=13°C, Feb=14°C, Mar=16°C, Apr=21°C, May=25°C, Jun=28°C, Jul=31°C, Aug=30°C, Sep=27°C, Oct=23°C, Nov=18°C, Dec=15°C

Year 5: Jan=14°C, Feb=15°C, Mar=17°C, Apr=22°C, May=26°C, Jun=29°C, Jul=32°C, Aug=31°C, Sep=28°C, Oct=24°C, Nov=19°C, Dec=16°C
message_2:
To analyze the seasonal pattern of monthly average temperatures in the city over a period of 5 years, we can use time series analysis. First, let's organize the data into a table format:

| Year | Jan | Feb | Mar | Apr | May | Jun | Jul | Aug | Sep | Oct | Nov | Dec |
|------|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|
| 1    | 10  | 11  | 13  | 18  | 22  | 25  | 28  | 27  | 24  | 20  | 15  | 12  |
| 2    | 11  | 12  | 14  | 19  | 23  | 26  | 29  | 28  | 25  | 21  | 16  | 13  |
| 3    | 12  | 13  | 15  | 20  | 24  | 27  | 30  | 29  | 26  | 22  | 17  | 14  |
| 4    | 13  | 14  | 16  | 21  | 25  | 28  | 31  | 30  | 27  | 23  | 18  | 15  |
| 5    | 14  | 15  | 17  | 22  | 26  | 29  | 32  | 31  | 28  | 24  | 19  | 16  |

Next, we can calculate the average temperature for each month across the 5 years:

| Month | Avg Temp |
|-------|----------|
| Jan   | 12       |
| Feb   | 13       |
| Mar   | 15       |
| Apr   | 20       |
| May   | 24       |
| Jun   | 27       |
| Jul   | 30       |
| Aug   | 29       |
| Sep   | 26       |
| Oct   | 22       |
| Nov   | 17       |
| Dec   | 14       |

Now, let's plot the average temperatures for each month:

```
30-|       x
   |        x
27-|         x
   |          x
24-|           x
   |            x
21-|             x
   |              x
18-|               x
   |                x
15-|                 x
   |                  x
12-|                   x
   +-----------------------
    Jan Feb Mar Apr May Jun
    Jul Aug Sep Oct Nov Dec
```

From the plot, we can observe a clear seasonal pattern in the data. The temperatures increase from January to July, then decrease from August to December. This pattern repeats every year, indicating a strong seasonality in the data.

As for the trend, we can see a gradual increase in temperatures for each month over the 5-year period. This suggests a warming trend in the city. However, to confirm this trend, further analysis using statistical methods like linear regression or more years of data would be required.
